page.title: 16The M25 Motorway
page.content: The M25 (the outer London orbital motorway)is being built on farmland to the west of the village .Much of the land being used was owned and farmed by Mr. Miller at Wested farm (see page 10 ).This section which goes from the Swanley interchange to the interchange at the foot of Polhill,was started in 1984 and hopes to be completed in 1986.The cost of the section will be high(between Â£40 and Â£50 millions) of the need to build a large number of bridges, underpasses,connecting roads,embankments and cuttings because the relief of the land.The motorway nearest to Crockenhill will be hidden from view by raised mounds of earth known as bunds.Only two people of Crockenhill opposed the motorway because the visual damage to the village and the fear the village would become a suburb of outer London.
